VEC.Q: How many slices are there in this pie chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this pie chart.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the clockwise direction from slice Investments?
SRP.A: The next slice clockwise from slice Investments is {Debt}.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the counterclockwise direction from slice Investments?
SRP.A: The next slice counterclockwise from slice Investments is {Cash Flow}.

VPR.Q: Which revenue has the largest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The revenue with the largest proportion is {Investments}.

VPR.Q: Which revenue has the smallest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The revenue with the smallest proportion is {Cash Flow}.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Equity slice in this pie chart?

VE.A: The value of the Operating Costs slice is {20}%.

VE.A: The value of the Cash Flow slice is {10}%.

SC.A: The difference between Equity and Cash Flow is {11}%.

SC.Q: What is the sum of the values of Operating Costs and Profit Margin in this pie chart?
SC.A: The sum of Operating Costs and Profit Margin is {34}%.

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart exceed 20.75%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.

NF.A: {Debt} accounts for {11}% and {Cash Flow} accounts for {10}%

NC.Q: Which is larger, the value of Investments or Equity?

MSR.Q: How many sectors have a percentage between 5% and 20%?
MSR.A: There are {4} sectors that have a percentage between 5% and 20%.

MSR.Q: Which three sectors have a sum of percentage less than 50%? List all possible combinations.
MSR.A: The possible combinations are: {(Investments, Profit Margin, Debt), (Investments, Profit Margin, Cash Flow), (Investments, Debt, Cash Flow), (Equity, Profit Margin, Debt), (Equity, Profit Margin, Cash Flow), (Equity, Debt, Cash Flow), (Operating Costs, Profit Margin, Debt), (Operating Costs, Profit Margin, Cash Flow), (Operating Costs, Debt, Cash Flow), (Profit Margin, Debt, Cash Flow)}.
